001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.ElapsedTime;
004import com.technototes.library.subsystem.DeviceSubsystem;
005import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.Set;
011import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
012import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
013import java.util.function.Supplier;
014
015/**
016 * The root Command class
017 *
018 * @author Alex Stedman
019 */
020@FunctionalInterface
021public interface Command extends Runnable, Supplier<Command.CommandState> {
022    // These are *static* fields of the Command interface, because interfaces aren't allowed
023    // to have member fields (because they're interfaces...)
024
025    /**
026     * The Command to Current State of the Command lookup
027     */
028    Map<Command, CommandState> stateMap = new HashMap<>();
029    /**
030     * The Command to Total Time Spent Running lookup
031     */
032    Map<Command, ElapsedTime> timeMap = new HashMap<>();
033    /**
034     * The Command to Required Subsystems lookup
035     */
036    Map<Command, Set<Subsystem>> requirementMap = new HashMap<>();
037
038    /**
039     * Add requirement subsystems to command
040     * <p>
041     * Requirements are subsystems upon which this command depends. When executing a command,
042     * any commands that are currently being executed which depend upon the subsystem(s) required
043     * will be cancelled by the CommandScheduler.
044     *
045     * @param requirements The subsystems this command uses
046     * @return this
047     */
048    default Command addRequirements(Subsystem... requirements) {
049        getRequirements().addAll(Arrays.asList(requirements));
050        return this;
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Init the command
055     * <p>
056     * Defaults to doing nothing
057     */
058    default void initialize() {}
059
060    /**
061     * Execute the command
062     * <p>
063     * This is (probably) where the majority of your command belongs
064     */
065    void execute();
066
067    /**
068     * Return if the command is finished
069     * <p>
070     * Defaults to returning *true* which means that the command will execute once and complete.
071     *
072     * @return Is the command finished
073     */
074    default boolean isFinished() {
075        return true;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * End the command
080     * <p>
081     * Defaults to doing nothing
082     *
083     * @param cancel True if the command was cancelled, False if it ended naturally
084     */
085    default void end(boolean cancel) {}
086
087    /**
088     * Run a command or series of ParallelCommands after this one
089     *
090     * @param c the list of commands to run
091     * @return the new SequentialCommandGroup of this Command, then the next set
092     */
093    default SequentialCommandGroup andThen(Command... c) {
094        return new SequentialCommandGroup(this, c.length == 1 ? c[0] : new ParallelCommandGroup(c));
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Delay the command for some time
099     *
100     * @param sec The number of sections to delay
101     * @return The new SequentialCommandGroup of this command and a WaitCommand
102     */
103    default SequentialCommandGroup sleep(double sec) {
104        return andThen(new WaitCommand(sec));
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Delay the command for some time
109     *
110     * @param sup A function that returns the number of sections to delay
111     * @return The new SequentialCommandGroup of this command and a WaitCommand
112     */
113    default SequentialCommandGroup sleep(DoubleSupplier sup) {
114        return andThen(new WaitCommand(sup));
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * After this command, wait until the condition function is true
119     *
120     * @param condition The function that returns true when ready to proceed
121     * @return the new SequentialCommandGroup of this command and a Conditional Command
122     * for waiting
123     */
124    default SequentialCommandGroup waitUntil(BooleanSupplier condition) {
125        return andThen(new ConditionalCommand(condition));
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Run this command in parallel with additional commands
130     *
131     * @param c the command (or list of commands) to be run in parallel
132     * @return a ParallelCommandGroup of this command, and all the c commands
133     */
134    default ParallelCommandGroup alongWith(Command... c) {
135        Command[] c1 = new Command[c.length + 1];
136        c1[0] = this;
137        System.arraycopy(c, 0, c1, 1, c.length);
138        return new ParallelCommandGroup(c1);
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Runs all the commands specified in parallel *until this command is completed*
143     *
144     * @param c The command or list of commands to run in parallel with this command
145     * @return a new ParallelDeadlineGroup with this command, and all the other commands
146     */
147    default ParallelDeadlineGroup deadline(Command... c) {
148        return new ParallelDeadlineGroup(this, c);
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Runs all the commands in parallel (including this command) until one of them finishes
153     *
154     * @param c the additional commands to run in parallel
155     * @return a ParallelRaceGroup
156     */
157    default ParallelRaceGroup raceWith(Command... c) {
158        Command[] c1 = new Command[c.length + 1];
159        c1[0] = this;
160        System.arraycopy(c, 0, c1, 1, c.length);
161        return new ParallelRaceGroup(c1);
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Creates a conditional command out of this
166     *
167     * @param condition The condition to run the command under
168     * @return the conditional command
169     */
170    default ConditionalCommand asConditional(BooleanSupplier condition) {
171        return new ConditionalCommand(condition, this);
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Runs this command until it either finishes, or the timeout has elapsed
176     *
177     * @param seconds The maximum number of seconds to wait
178     * @return A ParallelRaceGroup of this command and a WaitCommand
179     */
180    default ParallelRaceGroup withTimeout(double seconds) {
181        return raceWith(new WaitCommand(seconds));
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Runs this command until it finishes, or until the condition supplied is true
186     *
187     * @param condition A boolean function that returns true if the command should be cancelled
188     * @return A ParallelRaceGroup of this command and a ConditionalCommand of condition
189     */
190    default ParallelRaceGroup cancelUpon(BooleanSupplier condition) {
191        return raceWith(new ConditionalCommand(condition));
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Runs this command only if the choiceCondition is met (i.e. returns true)
196     *
197     * @param choiceCondition a boolean function that determins if this command should run or not
198     * @return a ChoiceCommand with this command as the "true" command.
199     */
200    default ChoiceCommand onlyIf(BooleanSupplier choiceCondition) {
201        return new ChoiceCommand(choiceCondition, this);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Run the commmand
206     */
207    @Override
208    default void run() {
209        switch (getState()) {
210            case RESET:
211                getRuntime().reset();
212                setState(CommandState.STARTED);
213                return;
214            case STARTED:
215                setState(CommandState.INITIALIZING);
216                return;
217            case INITIALIZING:
218                initialize();
219                setState(CommandState.EXECUTING);
220            // no return for fallthrough
221            case EXECUTING:
222                execute();
223                if (isFinished()) setState(CommandState.FINISHED);
224                return;
225            case INTERRUPTED:
226                // state to allow
227                setState(CommandState.CANCELLED);
228                return;
229            case CANCELLED:
230            case FINISHED:
231                end(isCancelled());
232                setState(CommandState.RESET);
233        }
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * The command state enum
238     */
239    enum CommandState {
240        /**
241         * The command has just be scheduled
242         */
243        RESET,
244        /**
245         * The command has been triggered
246         */
247        STARTED,
248        /**
249         * The command is initializing after having been triggered
250         */
251        INITIALIZING,
252        /**
253         * The command is running normally
254         */
255        EXECUTING,
256        /**
257         * The command has completed successfully
258         */
259        FINISHED,
260        /**
261         * The command is pending cancellation (but has not yet processed the cancellation)
262         */
263        INTERRUPTED,
264        /**
265         * The command has been cancelled
266         */
267        CANCELLED,
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Return the amount of time since the command was first initialized
272     *
273     * @return The runtime as an {@link ElapsedTime}
274     */
275    default ElapsedTime getRuntime() {
276        ElapsedTime t = timeMap.putIfAbsent(this, new ElapsedTime());
277        return t != null ? t : timeMap.get(this);
278    }
279
280    /**
281     * Return the command state: Probably don't use this
282     *
283     * @return The state as an {@link CommandState}
284     */
285    default CommandState getState() {
286        return stateMap.getOrDefault(this, CommandState.RESET);
287    }
288
289    /**
290     * Set the command state: DEFINITELY DO NOT USE THIS!
291     *
292     * @param s The state to set this command to
293     * @return This command
294     */
295    default Command setState(CommandState s) {
296        stateMap.put(this, s);
297        return this;
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Return the subsystem requirements for this command
302     *
303     * @return The {@link DeviceSubsystem} requirements
304     */
305    default Set<Subsystem> getRequirements() {
306        requirementMap.putIfAbsent(this, new LinkedHashSet<>());
307        return requirementMap.get(this);
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Is this command finished?
312     *
313     * @return True if the command has finished, or has been cancelled
314     */
315    default boolean justFinished() {
316        return (getState() == CommandState.FINISHED || getState() == CommandState.CANCELLED);
317    }
318
319    /**
320     * Is this command completed?
321     *
322     * @return True if the command has finished and NOT been cancelled.
323     */
324    default boolean justFinishedNoCancel() {
325        return getState() == CommandState.FINISHED;
326    }
327
328    /**
329     * Has the command just be started?
330     *
331     * @return True if the command was started, but hasn't yet been run
332     */
333    default boolean justStarted() {
334        return getState() == CommandState.STARTED;
335    }
336
337    /**
338     * Is the command in some state of running/started/finished/cancelled
339     *
340     * @return True if the command is not in the RESET state
341     */
342    default boolean isRunning() {
343        return getState() != CommandState.RESET;
344    }
345
346    /**
347     * Exactly what it says
348     *
349     * @return True if the command has been cancelled
350     */
351    default boolean isCancelled() {
352        return getState() == CommandState.CANCELLED;
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * If the command is running, interrupt it such that it can be cancelled
357     */
358    default void cancel() {
359        if (isRunning() && !justFinished()) setState(CommandState.INTERRUPTED);
360    }
361
362    /**
363     * Clear out the state, time, and requirement maps. Be careful with this one!
364     */
365    static void clear() {
366        stateMap.clear();
367        timeMap.clear();
368        requirementMap.clear();
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * This is a helper to create a new command from an existing command, but with additional
373     * subsystem requirements
374     *
375     * @param c The command to add the extra subsystem
376     * @param s The subsystem (or list of subsystems) to add to the commands requiremets
377     * @return The new command
378     */
379    static Command create(Command c, Subsystem... s) {
380        return c.addRequirements(s);
381    }
382
383    /**
384     * Gets the current state of the command (Supplier&lt;CommandState&gt;)
385     *
386     * @return The current CommandState of this command
387     */
388    @Override
389    default CommandState get() {
390        return getState();
391    }
392}
